tasks.input:
# Knowledge Representation using a dictionary
knowledge = {
    'AI': 'Artificial Intelligence',
    'ML': 'Machine Learning',
    'DL': 'Deep Learning',
    'NLP': 'Natural Language Processing'
}

# Data Preparation using a list of numbers
data = [10, 25, 15, 30, 20]

# Printing the knowledge representation
print("Knowledge Representation:")
for key, value in knowledge.items():
    print(f"{key}: {value}")

# Data Preparation - calculating the mean of the data
mean = sum(data) / len(data)
print("\nData Preparation:")
print("Data:", data)
print("Mean:", mean)

# Knowledge Representation using a list of books and authors
books = [
    {'title': 'The Great Gatsby', 'author': 'F. Scott Fitzgerald', 'genre': 'Fiction'},
    {'title': 'To Kill a Mockingbird', 'author': 'Harper Lee', 'genre': 'Fiction'},
    {'title': '1984', 'author': 'George Orwell', 'genre': 'Science Fiction'},
    {'title': 'Pride and Prejudice', 'author': 'Jane Austen', 'genre': 'Romance'},
    {'title': 'The Catcher in the Rye', 'author': 'J.D. Salinger', 'genre': 'Fiction'}
]

# Data Preparation - filtering books of a specific genre
genre_to_filter = 'Fiction'
filtered_books = [book for book in books if book['genre'] == genre_to_filter]

# Printing the knowledge representation
print("Knowledge Representation - Books:")
for book in books:
    print(f"Title: {book['title']}, Author: {book['author']}, Genre: {book['genre']}")

# Data Preparation - Printing filtered books
print("\nData Preparation:")
print(f"Books of genre '{genre_to_filter}':")
for book in filtered_books:
    print(f"Title: {book['title']}, Author: {book['author']}")
